maml:description.maml:para: Add a Folder to Environment Variable PATH
Add Folders to Environment Variable PATH for Machine, User or Process scope And removes missing PATH locations
Folder or Folders to add to PATH
Which Env Path the directory gets added to. Machine, User or Process
Folder or Folders to add to PATH
Which Env Path the directory gets added to. Machine, User or Process

dev:type.maml:name: String - List of the New Path Variable

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-EnvPath -Path 'C:\temp' -VariableTarget Machine

maml:description.maml:para: Install a font from file path using CSharp code, compatitable fonts are available for use within the console font list.
Path of Font File, can accept multiple font files Supported File Types - .ttc, .ttf, .fnt, .otf, .fon
Path of Font File, can accept multiple font files Supported File Types - .ttc, .ttf, .fnt, .otf, .fon

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-Font -Path C:\temp\mononoki-nerdfont.ttf

maml:description.maml:para: Add a folder to the PSModulePath variable
Add a folder to the PSModulePath variable for the current process

dev:type.maml:name: String if PassThru parameter is used

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-PSModulePath -Path D:\test\module-dir

maml:description.maml:para: Covert a path in between the Windows and the WSL path formats
Convert Path from WSL format to Windows format
Convert Path from Windows format to WSL format - Default
Convert Path from WSL format to Windows format
Convert Path from Windows format to WSL format - Default

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Convert Windows Path to WSL Convert-WSLPath -Path 'C:\temp\'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Convert WSL Path to Windows Convert-WSLPath -Path '/usr/bin/ssh' -ToWindows

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-ChildItem -Path D:\temp | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Name | ConvertTo-TitleCase

maml:description.maml:para: Get a summary of a folder ACL

This command will examine the ACL of a given folder and create a custom object. The object will include a count of access rules based on the identity reference. Any ACL that belongs to a builtin or system account, or Everyone and Creator Owner, will be counted as a SystemACL. Everything else will be counted as a UserACL. You might use this information to identify folders or files where ACLS aren't what you expect.
The custom object also contains an AccessRules property which will be a collection of the access rules for that object.

SystemACL : 7 Owner : BUILTIN\Administrators UserACL : 1 AccessRules : {System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule, System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule, System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule, System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule...} Path : C:\work TotalACL : 8
It is assumed you will use this with the FileSystem provider.
This version of the command uses a format file which is loaded "on the fly" so by default, information is presented as a nicely formatted table without the AccessRules property.
The path of the folder to analyze. The default is the current directory.
The path of the folder to analyze. The default is the current directory.

maml:alert.maml:para: NAME : Get-ACLInfo VERSION : 0.9 LAST UPDATED: 6/21/2012 AUTHOR : Jeffery Hicks (http://jdhitsolutions.com/blog)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-ACLInfo D:\Files Get acl data on the Files folder.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-ChildItem e:\groups\data -Recurse | Where-Object {$_.PSIsContainer} | Get-ACLInfo Get acl information for every folder under e:\groups\data.

maml:description.maml:para: Uses git.exe to clone the gists and repositories of a github user. Can Exclude repositories with names that match the string/strings defined with -Exclude Requires Module - PowerShellForGitHub Requires git.exe

I included the source file for PForEach because it is no longer visible in the powershellgallery and github Vasily Larionov - https://www.powershellgallery.com/profiles/vlariono | https://github.com/vlariono PForEach - https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PForEach
Param2 help - Directory to save User Gists and Repositories
Param3 help - Exclude Repositories with Names matching these strings
Param2 help - Directory to save User Gists and Repositories
Param3 help - Exclude Repositories with Names matching these strings

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-GitHubUserRepos -UserName WozNet -Path 'V:\git\users' -Exclude 'docs'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: 'WozNet','PowerShell','Microsoft' | Get-GitHubUserRepos -Path 'V:\git\users' -Exclude 'azure,'office365'

maml:description.maml:para: Uses PSWindowsUpdate to install available Windows Updates via this fuction - Get-WindowsUpdate
Reboot Computer if needed to finish installed the Windows Updates
Reboot Computer if needed to finish installed the Windows Updates

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-PSWinUpdates.
Table - Get-PSWinUpdates outputs the properties X,ComputerName,Result,KB,Size,Title from the Get-WindowsUpdate function

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-PSWinUpdates

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-PSWinUpdates -Reboot

maml:description.maml:para: Location the repository folder will be saved to
Location the repository folder will be saved to

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-GitClone -Repo https://github.com/Woznet/WozTools.git -Path D:\git\repos

maml:description.maml:para: Invoke a scriptblock from within one or more directories
Path of one or more directories which the scriptblock will be invoked in
Path of one or more directories which the scriptblock will be invoked in

dev:type.maml:name: You can pipe the output from Get-Item,
A string that contains a path
This function will output whatever is returned from the scriptblock each time it is run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-InDirectory -Path 'X:\git\WozTools' -ScriptBlock { git fetch --all }

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-ChildItem -Path 'X:\git\' -Directory | Invoke-InDirectory -ScriptBlock { git fetch --all }

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: 'X:\git\WozTools','.\Git Stuff' | Invoke-InDirectory -ScriptBlock { git fetch --all }

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-Parser -Path C:\temp\random-script.ps1

maml:description.maml:para: Generate ANSI escape code string for outputing text with color
Create ANSI color escape code using a RGB color value

maml:alert.maml:para: FYI: Remeber to reset the text style after every stylized text, otherwise the ANSI effects will continue to be applied to all that get output later.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Create variable with desired color $ANSI1 = New-ANSIString # Create variable to reset ANSI effects $Reset = New-ANSIString -Reset # String getting colored $Text = 'This is a test. More testing... and testing'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Create variable with desired foreground color $ANSIFG1 = New-ANSIString -Red 55 -Green 120 -Blue 190 -Foreground # Create variable with desired background color $ANSIBG1 = New-ANSIString -Green 100 -Background # Create variable to reset ANSI effects $Reset = New-ANSIString -Reset # String getting colored $Text = 'This is a test. More testing... and testing' $Text2 = 'More and more and more!'

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Displays a progress bar within a Windows PowerShell command window.
The Write-Progress cmdlet displays a progress bar in a Windows PowerShell command window that depicts the status of a running command or script.
Object use in your foreach processing
Specifies an ID that distinguishes each progress bar from the others.
Specifies the parent activity of the current activity.
Specifies an ID that distinguishes each progress bar from the others.
Specifies the parent activity of the current activity.
